name: HR 8799
scenarioDescription:
The HR 8799 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HR 8799 is a star with 1.61 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

HR 8799 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HR 8799 system


HR 8799 b

HR 8799 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 68.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HR 8799 b is 2226 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HR 8799 b is 13 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HR 8799 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
